ground_truth: The gum-chewing, bored-looking receptionist looks at the clock: three minutes past two. His face unflinching, Peter unties the two fasteners keeping the pizzas together, one after the other. He glances up at the receptionist, then walks back towards the janitor's cupboard he emerged from. The receptionist eyes Peter suspiciously as he turns to the elevators he just walked past. He presses a button, the doors open, and he steps into an elevator. He presses another button, gives the receptionist a friendly smile and a wave, and the doors close. Back at Joe's Pizza, with Mister Aziz, Mister Aziz stares at the eager, bright-eyed youth, steps up to him, and reaches for Peter's helmet. He rips the Joe's Pizza sticker from it. Later, at the Bugle, he hands over the chitty, and Miss Brant chucks Peter's chin and strolls away. Peter smiles self-consciously. The opposing columnated University building, pathways in front of it, Peter runs through the campus and collides with a student. He bends to pick up his book. One student stands on his books, the bags of others hit Peter. He rises as Doctor Connors takes a few paces past Peter, stops, then turns. The brow of the thin-faced Doctor Connors furrows as he walks away, the right sleeve of his coat is empty. Night, Peter on his moped, moves into the garden of a wooden, suburban hedge, he enters the house, takes off his helmet, satchel and jacket, and stares at Harry Osborn. Harry watches MJ go. Harry frowns at Peter, who stares back flatly. When Peter doesn't respond, Harry rises and walks away, stands, hands on hips, and looks at a framed photograph of his father with Peter. Peter puts his hand on Harry's shoulder. The lights go out, and Peter blows out the candles on his birthday cake. Later that night, Aunt May is asleep at the table, letters and papers by her. He walks around the table and takes hold of his aunt's hand. Aunt May reaches into her purse. Tears well in Peter's eyes. Aunt May kisses Peter on the cheek and walks away. Peter struggles to fight back the tears, takes the litter out into the backyard in a plastic bin bag, and strides to the bottom of the garden, not noticing MJ sitting on the steps of the house next door. MJ walks towards him. Peter gazes at her. She moves closer to him, leaning over the fence. He shakes his head, his eyes flitting from hers to her mouth. The two of them stand as if transfixed. Peter starts to speak. MJ stares at him expectantly. Again, he shakes his head and lowers his eyes. She keeps hers fixed on him. He looks up again and tries to smile.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The clock is looked at by the gum-chewing, bored-looking receptionist: three minutes past two. The two fasteners keeping the pizzas together are untied by Peter, one after the other, his face unflinching. The receptionist is glanced up at by him, then he walks back towards the janitor's cupboard from which he emerged. Peter is eyed suspiciously by the receptionist as he turns to the elevators he just walked past. A button is pressed by him, the doors open, and an elevator is stepped into by him. Another button is pressed by him, he gives the receptionist a friendly smile and a wave, and the doors close. Back at Joe's Pizza, Mister Aziz stares at the eager, bright-eyed youth, steps up to him, and Peter's helmet is reached for by him. The Joe's Pizza sticker is ripped from it by him. Later, at the Bugle, the chitty is handed over by him, and Peter's chin is chucked by Miss Brant, who strolls away. Peter smiles self-consciously. The opposing columnated University building, pathways in front of it, is run through by Peter, and a student is collided with by him. His book is bent to be picked up by him. One student stands on his books, and the bags of others hit him. He rises, Doctor Connors taking a few paces past him, stopping, then turning. The brow of the thin-faced Doctor Connors furrows as he walks away, the right sleeve of his coat being empty. At night, Peter on his moped moves into the garden of a wooden, suburban hedge, the house is entered by him, his helmet, satchel, and jacket are taken off, and Harry Osborn is stared at by him. MJ is watched by Harry as she goes. Harry frowns at him, who stares back flatly. When he doesn't respond, Harry rises and walks away, then stands, hands on hips, looking at a framed photograph of his father with him. Harry's shoulder is touched by Peter's hand. The lights go out, and the candles on his birthday cake are blown out by him. Later that night, Aunt May is asleep at the table, letters and papers by her. The table is walked around by him and his aunt's hand is taken hold of by him. Her purse is reached into by Aunt May. Tears well in his eyes. Peter is kissed on the cheek by Aunt May, who walks away. The tears are struggled to be fought back by Peter, who takes the litter out into the backyard in a plastic bin bag and strides to the bottom of the garden, not noticing MJ sitting on the steps of the house next door. She walks towards him. Her gaze is returned by him. She moves closer to him, leaning over the fence. His head is shaken by him, his eyes flitting from hers to her mouth. The two of them stand as if transfixed. Speaking is started by him. He is stared at expectantly by her. Again, his head is shaken by him and his eyes are lowered. Hers remain fixed on him. His eyes look up again and a smile is attempted by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The gum-chewing, bored receptionist glances at the clock: 2:03. Peter, expressionless, unties the two pizza fasteners, looks at the receptionist, and heads back toward the janitor’s cupboard he came from. The receptionist watches Peter suspiciously as he turns to the elevators, presses the button, enters, smiles and waves as the doors close. At Joe’s Pizza, Mister Aziz rips the sticker from Peter’s helmet. Later at the Bugle, Peter hands over a chitty, Miss Brant chuckles, taps his chin, and walks off. Peter smiles awkwardly. Outside the columned University building, Peter runs, collides with a student, and scrambles for his book. Another student steps on his things, and bags hit him. Doctor Connors walks past, pauses, turns. His brow furrows as he leaves—his coat’s right sleeve empty. That night, Peter rides his moped to a suburban house, enters, removes his gear, and sees Harry Osborn. Harry watches MJ leave, then frowns at Peter. When Peter stays silent, Harry walks away and stares at a photo of his father with Peter. Peter puts a hand on his shoulder. The lights go out, and Peter blows out his birthday candles. Later, Aunt May sleeps at the table surrounded by papers. Peter gently takes her hand. She reaches into her purse, kisses his cheek, and walks away. Peter, emotional, carries the trash to the backyard, not seeing MJ sitting next door. She approaches, leans over the fence. Peter gazes at her, then shakes his head, eyes moving from hers to her lips. They stand still. Peter tries to speak, then lowers his gaze. She watches him steadily. He looks up and attempts a smile.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The bored receptionist checks the clock: 2:03. Peter unties the pizzas, glances at the receptionist, and heads back to the janitor's cupboard. The receptionist watches him suspiciously as Peter turns to the elevators, presses a button, smiles, waves, and the doors close. At Joe's Pizza, Mister Aziz removes the sticker from Peter's helmet. Later, at the Bugle, Miss Brant chucks Peter's chin after he hands over the chitty. Peter runs through the university campus, collides with a student, and picks up his book. Doctor Connors, with an empty sleeve, furrows his brow and walks away. At night, Peter enters a house, removes his gear, and stares at Harry Osborn, who frowns back. Harry looks at a photo of his father with Peter. Peter touches Harry's shoulder. The lights go out, and Peter blows out his birthday candles. Later, Aunt May sleeps at the table. Peter holds her hand, tears welling up. Aunt May kisses him and walks away. Peter takes out the trash, not noticing MJ next door. MJ approaches, and they stand transfixed. Peter starts to speak, shakes his head, and tries to smile as MJ watches expectantly.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The gum-chewing receptionist, who appears utterly bored and disinterested, glances up at the clock hanging on the wall: it reads three minutes past two. Without a change in his expression, Peter methodically unties the two fasteners that are keeping the stack of pizzas securely together, doing so one after the other. He briefly glances up at the receptionist, then turns and walks back towards the janitor's cupboard from which he had earlier emerged. The receptionist watches Peter with a suspicious eye as he turns his attention to the elevators he had just walked past moments ago. He presses a button, the elevator doors slide open, and he steps inside. Once inside, he presses another button, then offers the receptionist a friendly smile and a wave before the doors close. Meanwhile, back at Joe's Pizza, Mister Aziz stands with a stern expression, staring at the eager, bright-eyed youth. He steps up to Peter and reaches for his helmet, ripping the Joe's Pizza sticker from it with a swift motion. Later, at the Bugle, Peter hands over the chitty, and Miss Brant affectionately chucks Peter's chin before strolling away. Peter smiles self-consciously, feeling a bit bashful. At the opposing columnated University building, with pathways stretching out in front of it, Peter runs through the bustling campus and accidentally collides with a student. He bends down to pick up his book, but one student stands on his books, and the bags of others hit Peter as they pass by. He rises to his feet just as Doctor Connors takes a few paces past him, then stops and turns around. The brow of the thin-faced Doctor Connors furrows with concern as he walks away, the right sleeve of his coat hanging empty. As night falls, Peter rides his moped into the garden of a wooden, suburban house surrounded by a hedge. He enters the house, removes his helmet, satchel, and jacket, and stares at Harry Osborn. Harry watches MJ leave, then frowns at Peter, who stares back with a flat expression. When Peter doesn't respond, Harry rises from his seat and walks away, standing with his hands on his hips as he looks at a framed photograph of his father with Peter. Peter gently places his hand on Harry's shoulder. The lights go out, and Peter blows out the candles on his birthday cake. Later that night, Aunt May is asleep at the table, surrounded by letters and papers. Peter walks around the table and tenderly takes hold of his aunt's hand. Aunt May reaches into her purse, and tears begin to well up in Peter's eyes. Aunt May kisses Peter on the cheek and walks away. Peter struggles to fight back the tears, then takes the litter out into the backyard in a plastic bin bag, striding to the bottom of the garden, not noticing MJ sitting quietly on the steps of the house next door. MJ walks towards him, and Peter gazes at her intently. She moves closer to him, leaning over the fence. He shakes his head, his eyes flitting from hers to her mouth. The two of them stand as if transfixed by the moment. Peter starts to speak, but MJ stares at him expectantly. Once again, he shakes his head and lowers his eyes. She keeps hers fixed on him, unwavering. He looks up again and tries to muster a smile.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The gum-chewing receptionist, who appears utterly bored and disinterested in his surroundings, slowly glances up at the clock hanging prominently on the wall: it reads three minutes past the hour of two. Without exhibiting any change in his expression, Peter methodically begins to untie the two fasteners that are securely keeping the stack of pizzas together, doing so one after another with precision. He briefly glances up at the receptionist, noticing her suspicious gaze, before turning and walking back towards the janitor's cupboard from which he had earlier emerged. The receptionist watches Peter with a wary and suspicious eye as he diverts his attention to the elevators he had just walked past only moments ago. He presses a button, causing the elevator doors to slide open (a soft ding accompanying them), and proceeds to step inside. Once he is inside, he presses another button, then offers the receptionist a friendly smile along with a wave before the doors close. Meanwhile, back at Joe's Pizza, Mister Aziz stands with a stern and unyielding expression, staring intently at the eager, bright-eyed youth. He steps up to Peter and reaches for his helmet, ripping the Joe's Pizza sticker from it with a swift and decisive motion. Later, at the bustling Bugle, Peter hands over the chitty, and Miss Brant affectionately chucks Peter's chin before casually strolling away. Peter smiles self-consciously, feeling a bit bashful about the interaction. At the opposing, columnated University building, with pathways stretching out expansively in front of it, Peter runs through the bustling campus and accidentally collides with a student. He bends down to pick up his book, but one inconsiderate student stands on his books, and the bags of others hit Peter as they pass by in a hurry. He rises to his feet just as Doctor Connors takes a few deliberate paces past him, then decides to stop and turn around. The brow of the thin-faced Doctor Connors furrows with concern as he continues to walk away, the right sleeve of his coat visibly hanging empty. As night begins to fall, Peter rides his moped into the garden of a wooden, suburban house that is surrounded by a neat hedge. He enters the house, removes his helmet, satchel, and jacket, and stares at Harry Osborn. Harry watches MJ leave, then frowns at Peter, who stares back with a flat expression, remaining silent. When Peter does not respond, Harry rises from his seat and walks away, standing with his hands on his hips as he looks at a framed photograph of his father with Peter. Peter gently places his hand on Harry's shoulder, trying to convey some comfort. The lights go out, and Peter solemnly blows out the candles on his birthday cake. Later that night, Aunt May is asleep at the table, surrounded by letters and various papers. Peter walks around the table and tenderly takes hold of his aunt's hand. Aunt May reaches into her purse, and tears begin to well up in Peter's eyes. Aunt May kisses Peter on the cheek and walks away. Peter struggles to fight back the tears, then takes the litter out into the backyard in a plastic bin bag, striding to the bottom of the garden, not noticing MJ sitting quietly on the steps of the house next door. MJ walks towards him, and Peter gazes at her intently as she approaches. She moves closer to him, leaning over the fence that separates them. He shakes his head, his eyes flitting from hers to her inviting mouth. The two of them stand as if transfixed by the moment. Peter starts to speak, but MJ stares at him expectantly, waiting for his words. Once again, he shakes his head and lowers his eyes. She keeps hers fixed on him, unwavering and determined. He looks up once again and tries to muster a smile.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The gum-chewing, bored-looking receptionist shifts her gaze to the clock, noting that it is three minutes past two. Meanwhile, Peter, maintaining an unflinching expression, methodically unties the two fasteners that are securing the pizzas together, doing so one after the other with deliberate care. He then briefly glances up at the receptionist, assessing her demeanor, before turning and walking back towards the janitor's cupboard from which he had previously emerged. As Peter moves, the receptionist watches him with a suspicious eye, particularly as he turns his attention to the elevators he had just walked past. With a purposeful stride, he approaches the elevator, presses the button, and waits momentarily as the doors slide open. He steps inside the elevator, presses another button to select his desired floor, and, before the doors close, he offers the receptionist a friendly smile and a wave. Meanwhile, back at Joe's Pizza, Mister Aziz stands before an eager, bright-eyed youth, scrutinizing him with a critical eye. He steps up to Peter, reaches for his helmet, and decisively rips the Joe's Pizza sticker from it, signaling a change in their relationship. Later, at the Bugle, Peter hands over the chitty, and Miss Brant, in a playful gesture, chucks Peter's chin before strolling away, leaving Peter to smile self-consciously in response. At the opposing columnated University building, with pathways stretching out in front of it, Peter runs energetically through the campus, only to collide with a student. He quickly bends down to pick up his book, but as he does so, one student inadvertently steps on his books, and the bags of others jostle against him. Rising to his feet, Peter notices Doctor Connors taking a few paces past him, then stopping and turning back. The thin-faced Doctor Connors furrows his brow in contemplation as he walks away, his right sleeve conspicuously empty. As night falls, Peter rides his moped into the garden of a wooden, suburban hedge, dismounts, and enters the house. He removes his helmet, satchel, and jacket, and his gaze settles on Harry Osborn, who is watching MJ leave. Harry frowns at Peter, who returns the look with a flat stare. When Peter remains silent, Harry rises, walks away, and stands with his hands on his hips, looking at a framed photograph of his father with Peter. In a gesture of camaraderie, Peter places his hand on Harry's shoulder. Suddenly, the lights go out, and Peter is left to blow out the candles on his birthday cake in the dim light. Later that night, Aunt May is asleep at the table, surrounded by letters and papers. Peter quietly walks around the table, gently takes hold of his aunt's hand, and watches as Aunt May reaches into her purse. Tears begin to well in Peter's eyes as Aunt May kisses him on the cheek and walks away. Struggling to hold back his emotions, Peter takes the litter out into the backyard in a plastic bin bag, striding to the bottom of the garden without noticing MJ sitting on the steps of the house next door. As MJ walks towards him, Peter gazes at her, captivated by her presence. She moves closer, leaning over the fence, and he shakes his head, his eyes darting from hers to her mouth. The two of them stand as if transfixed, caught in a moment of unspoken connection. Peter starts to speak, but MJ stares at him expectantly, waiting for his words. Once more, he shakes his head and lowers his eyes, while she keeps hers fixed on him. Finally, he looks up again and attempts to smile, trying to convey what words cannot.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The gum-chewing, bored-looking receptionist glances at the clock, noting it's three minutes past two. Peter unties the fasteners securing the pizzas, glances at the receptionist, and heads back toward the janitor's cupboard. The receptionist watches him suspiciously as he turns to the elevators, presses a button, and steps inside. After pressing another button, he gives the receptionist a friendly smile and wave as the doors close. At Joe's Pizza, Mister Aziz approaches Peter, removes the Joe's Pizza sticker from his helmet, and stares at the eager youth. Later, at the Bugle, Peter hands over the chitty, and Miss Brant playfully chucks his chin before strolling away, leaving Peter smiling self-consciously. On campus, Peter runs through the pathways, collides with a student, and bends to pick up his book. As he rises, Doctor Connors walks past, stops, and turns, his brow furrowed, before walking away with his coat's right sleeve empty. That night, Peter rides his moped into a suburban garden, enters the house, and removes his helmet, satchel, and jacket, staring at Harry Osborn. Harry watches MJ leave, frowns at Peter, and when Peter doesn't respond, he walks away to look at a photograph of his father with Peter. Peter places a hand on Harry's shoulder. The lights go out, and Peter blows out the candles on his birthday cake. Later, Aunt May is asleep at the table surrounded by letters and papers. Peter gently takes her hand, and Aunt May reaches into her purse, tears welling in Peter's eyes as she kisses his cheek and walks away. Struggling to hold back tears, Peter takes the trash to the backyard, unaware of MJ sitting on the steps next door. As MJ approaches, Peter gazes at her, and they stand transfixed. Peter starts to speak, but shakes his head, eyes flitting from hers to her mouth. MJ watches him expectantly, and he looks up again, attempting a smile.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The gum-chewing, bored-looking receptionist, a staple at the front desk known for her lackadaisical demeanor, looks at the clock: three minutes past two. His face unflinching, Peter, who moonlights as a delivery boy for one of New York City's most popular pizza joints, unties the two fasteners keeping the pizzas together, one after the other. He glances up at the receptionist, then walks back towards the janitor's cupboard he emerged from, a hidden spot he often uses to quickly change in and out of his superhero costume. The receptionist eyes Peter suspiciously as he turns to the elevators he just walked past. He presses a button, the doors open, and he steps into an elevator. He presses another button, gives the receptionist a friendly smile and a wave, and the doors close. Back at Joe's Pizza, with Mister Aziz, the owner known for his tough love approach to management, Mister Aziz stares at the eager, bright-eyed youth, steps up to him, and reaches for Peter's helmet. He rips the Joe's Pizza sticker from it, a sign of Peter's numerous lateness that cost the store its "guaranteed delivery" times. Later, at the Bugle, the bustling newspaper office known for its sensational headlines, he hands over the chitty, and Miss Brant, J. Jonah Jameson's sharp-witted assistant, chucks Peter's chin and strolls away. Peter smiles self-consciously. The opposing columnated University building, one of the oldest on campus, pathways in front of it, Peter runs through the campus and collides with a student. He bends to pick up his book. One student stands on his books, the bags of others hit Peter. He rises as Doctor Connors, a brilliant but distracted professor at the university, takes a few paces past Peter, stops, then turns. The brow of the thin-faced Doctor Connors furrows as he walks away, the right sleeve of his coat is empty, a reminder of the accident that cost him his arm. Night, Peter on his moped, moves into the garden of a wooden, suburban hedge, he enters the house he shares with Harry Osborn, takes off his helmet, satchel, and jacket, and stares at Harry Osborn, whose father founded Oscorp Industries. Harry watches MJ go. Harry frowns at Peter, who stares back flatly. When Peter doesn't respond, Harry rises and walks away, stands, hands on hips, and looks at a framed photograph of his father, Norman Osborn, with Peter. Peter puts his hand on Harry's shoulder. The lights go out, and Peter blows out the candles on his birthday cake. Later that night, Aunt May, known for her unwavering support of Peter despite financial hardships, is asleep at the table, letters and papers by her. He walks around the table and takes hold of his aunt's hand. Aunt May reaches into her purse. Tears well in Peter's eyes. Aunt May kisses Peter on the cheek and walks away. Peter struggles to fight back the tears, takes the litter out into the backyard in a plastic bin bag, and strides to the bottom of the garden, not noticing MJ sitting on the steps of the house next door, her presence a constant reminder of his unspoken feelings for her. MJ walks towards him. Peter gazes at her. She moves closer to him, leaning over the fence. He shakes his head, his eyes flitting from hers to her mouth, a sign of his inner turmoil and affection. The two of them stand as if transfixed. Peter starts to speak. MJ stares at him expectantly. Again, he shakes his head and lowers his eyes. She keeps hers fixed on him. He looks up again and tries to smile.

test_cases.description: The gumchewing boredlooking receptionist looks at the clock three minutes past two. His face unflinching. Peter unties the two fasteners keeping the pizzas together one after the other. He glances up at the receptionist then walks back towards the janitor's cupboard he emerged from. The receptionist eyes Peter suspiciously as he turns to the elevators he just walked past. He presses a button the doors open and he steps into an elevator. He presses another button gives the receptionist a friendly smile and a wave and the doors close. Back at Joe's Pizza with Mister Aziz. Mister Aziz stares at the eager brighteyed youth steps up to him and reaches for Peter's helmet. He rips the Joe's Pizza sticker from it. Later at the Bugle he hands over the chitty and Miss Brant chucks Peter's chin and strolls away. Peter smiles selfconsciously. The opposing columnated University building pathways in front of it. Peter runs through the campus and collides with a student. He bends to pick up his book. One student stands on his books. the bags of others hit Peter. He rises as Doctor Connors takes a few paces past. Peter stops then turns. The brow of the thinfaced Doctor Connors furrows as he walks away. the right sleeve of his coat is empty. Night. Peter on his moped moves into the garden of a wooden suburban hedge. he enters the house takes off his helmet satchel and jacket and stares at Harry Osborn. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Harry watches MJ go. Harry frowns at Peter who stares back flatly. When Peter does not respond Harry rises and walks away stands hands on hips and looks at a framed photograph of his father with Peter. Peter puts his hand on Harry's shoulder. The lights go out and Peter blows out the candles on his birthday cake. Later that night Aunt May is asleep at the table. letters and papers by her. He walks around the table and takes hold of his aunt's hand. Aunt May reaches into her purse. Tears well in Peter's eyes. Aunt May kisses Peter on the cheek and walks away. Peter struggles to fight back the tears takes the litter out into the backyard in a plastic bin bag and strides to the bottom of the garden not noticing. MJ sitting on the steps of the house next door. MJ walks towards him. Peter gazes at her. She moves closer to him leaning over the fence. He shakes his head his eyes flitting from hers to her mouth. The two of them stand as if transfixed. Peter starts to speak. MJ stares at him expectantly. Again. he shakes his head and lowers his eyes. She keeps hers fixed on him. He looks up again and tries to smile.

Peter unties the two fasteners keeping the pizzas together one after the other. He glances up at the receptionist then walks back towards the janitor's cupboard he emerged from. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The biscuit-crunching, intrigued-looking gardener examines the sundial: seven seconds past midnight. His expression unwavering, Victor loosens the three zippers binding the balloons together, one after the other. He peeks up at the gardener, then skips back towards the carpenter’s locker he exited from. The gardener examines Victor skeptically as he spins to the ladders he just skipped by. He taps a lever, the gates unfold, and he jumps into a ladder. He taps another lever, sends the gardener a cheerful grin and a salute, and the gates close. Back at Lucy’s Bakery, with Captain Beck, Captain Beck glances at the timid, wide-eyed kitten, leaps up to her, and reaches for Victor’s backpack. He tears the Lucy’s Bakery label from it. Later, at the Herald, she delivers the scroll, and Lady Vogue pats Victor’s shoulder and glides away. Victor grins awkwardly. The adjacent trellised Museum chamber, hallways around it, Victor sprints through the atrium and bumps into a tourist. He crouches to gather his pen. One tourist steps on his pens, the jackets of others brush Victor. He stands as Engineer Magnus trots a few steps beyond Victor, pauses, then spins. The forehead of the broad-faced Engineer Magnus wrinkles as he skips away, the left pocket of his cloak is vacant. Dawn, Victor on his skateboard, glides into the park of a brick, urban fence, he enters the cabin, removes his cap, backpack and cloak, and stares at Henry Johnson. Henry observes MK depart. Henry scowls at Victor, who peers back impassively. When Victor doesn't react, Henry leaps and skips off, stands, arms akimbo, and glances at a watercolor of his uncle with Victor. Victor places his elbow on Henry’s back. The lamps flicker out, and Victor snuffs out the torches on his anniversary bread. Earlier that morning, Aunt Ruby is napping at the couch, books and newspapers beside her. He shuffles around the couch and clasps his aunt's shoulder. Aunt Ruby rummages in her handbag. Hiccups well in Victor’s throat. Aunt Ruby hugs Victor on the forehead and strolls away. Victor wrestles to hold back the laughter, carries the trash into the street in a woven wicker basket, and marches to the edge of the park, not spotting MK perched on the porch of the cabin next door. MK strolls toward him. Victor gapes at her. She drifts closer to him, leaning over the trellis. He nods his head, his gaze shifting from hers to her feet. The pair of them stand as if enraptured. Victor begins to hum. MK gazes at him intently. Again, he nods his head and averts his gaze. She retains hers locked on him. He glances up once more and attempts to grin.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The receptionist eyes Peter suspiciously as he prepares pizzas, smiles, and enters an elevator. Back at Joe's Pizza, Mister Aziz removes Peter's helmet sticker. At the Bugle, Miss Brant teases Peter, making him smile self-consciously. Peter races through campus, colliding with a student. Doctor Connors, noticing Peter, walks away, revealing his empty coat sleeve. Later, Peter returns home, removes his gear, and exchanges tense glances with Harry Osborn over a photo of Harry's father with Peter. During a power outage, Peter blows out candles on his birthday cake. That night, Peter finds Aunt May asleep at the table with letters and papers, and they share a tender moment. Outside, taking out the trash, Peter encounters MJ next door. They stand transfixed, with Peter struggling to speak, and MJ watching him expectantly. He shakes his head, finally managing a weak smile as she keeps her gaze fixed on him.
